meanings.definition: To turn around a central point.
meanings.sent1: I rotate the wheel to make the car move forward.
meanings.sent2: The Earth rotates on its axis, causing day and night.
meanings.sent3: Why did the chicken rotate in the road? To get to the other side!
meanings.sent4: Time seems to rotate faster when you're having fun.
meanings.sent5: The ballerina's graceful rotate captivated the audience.

meanings.sent1: We rotate players during the game to give everyone a chance to play.
meanings.sent2: The students rotate in line to take turns using the computer.
meanings.sent3: Why did the music notes rotate? They wanted to play a different tune!
meanings.sent4: The seasons rotate like a colorful carousel throughout the year.
meanings.sent5: The workers rotate shifts to ensure fair distribution of workload.

meanings.definition: To change or alternate in a regular order.
meanings.sent1: I rotate my outfits so I wear something different each day.
meanings.sent2: The colors on the traffic light rotate from red to green to yellow.
meanings.sent3: Why did the plants rotate positions? They wanted to get more sunlight!
meanings.sent4: Ideas rotate in my mind like a revolving door, always changing.
meanings.sent5: The flavors of ice cream rotate weekly at the shop to offer variety.
